variable.name: tclConfigData
variable.description: free text containing TCL configuration information

variable.name: timeStamp
variable.description: “YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM:SS.xxx”, xxx are the milliseconds”\nbased on GMT

variable.name: adaptorConfigData
variable.description: free text containing the constituent configuration\nidentification (e.g. release note reference)

variable.name: companyId
variable.description:
identifier of the supplier of the Adaptor
The identity is defined by NID_XUSER, see
0-255=ERA_ERTMS_040001 ASSIGNMENT OF
VALUES TO ETCS VARIABLES
1000-9999=user defined

variable.name: logname
variable.description: name of the logfile; max length: 25 characters\n(only numbers and letters allowed)

variable.name: logname
variable.description: name of the logfile; max length: 25 characters\n(only numbers and letters allowed)

variable.name: transfer
variable.description: true = activate transfer to TCL\nfalse = no transfer

variable.name: data
variable.description:
may contain the data of all attached RBCs
The content of this data file is not harmonized.
The analysis is a task of the RBC Adaptor
supplier.

variable.name: sequenceNumber
variable.description:
sequence number starting with “1”
The complete logfile should be split into a
sequence of “LOGGING.result” due to network
resources

variable.name: complete
variable.description: false = the sequence will be continued\ntrue = last message of the sequence

variable.name: companyId
variable.description:
identifier of the supplier of the Adaptor
The identity is defined by NID_XUSER; see
0-255=ERA_ERTMS_040001 ASSIGNMENT OF
VALUES TO ETCS VARIABLES
1000-9999=user defined

variable.name: freeMessageId
variable.description: identifier of message for specific use to be defined\nby each company

variable.name: freeMessage
variable.description: the message itself.\nThe structure of this message is not harmonised.

variable.name: textId
variable.description: id of a predefined text or id of the text defined in\nthis message

variable.name: location
variable.description: location to trigger text message; empty if not\napplicable.

variable.name: direction
variable.description: direction related to location where text is applicable\n-1 = ignore condition

variable.name: confirm
variable.description: true = driver has to confirm the message\nfalse = ignore condition or not to be confirmed

variable.name: text
variable.description: limited to 255 characters\nempty text means that the textId is a predefined\ntext

variable.name: tsrId
variable.description: If the TSR ID is a predefined TSR then no\ndetailed information is needed

variable.name: position
variable.description: The “lineLocation”s shall be ordered in one\ndirection.

variable.name: direction
variable.description:
1 = “up”: from “segmentId/startOffset” of the first
“lineLocation” up to “segmentId/endOffset” of the
last “lineLocation” defined in “position”
2 = “down”: reverse to 1
-1 = Ignore condition.

variable.name: tsrType
variable.description:
type of TSR
-1 = n/a
0 = TSR
1 = SSP
2 = Combination

variable.name: trackOccupationId
variable.description: unique identifier of the occupation area

variable.name: requestId
variable.description:
1 = Confirm Position (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D33)
2 = Accept train (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D22)
3 = Reject train (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D22)
4 = Delete Train (de-register train)
5 = Permit Shunting Request (SUBSET-026-5 5.6.3
S050)

variable.name: handleTrain
variable.description:
1 = Confirm Position (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D33)
2 = Accept train (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D22)
3 = Reject train (SUBSET-026-5 5.4.4 D22)
4 = Delete Train (de-register train)
5 = Shunting Request Permitted (SUBSET-026-5 5.6.3
S050)
6 = Shunting Request Refused (SUBSET-026-5 5.6.3
S050)

variable.name: position
variable.description: The position must be the front of the train from\nposition report.

variable.name: maLength
variable.description: -1 = Unknown\nMovement Authority length. Length of MA in meter\nfrom LRBG.

variable.name: ackedMaLength
variable.description: 1 = Unknown\nAcknowledged MA length. Length of acknowledged\nMA in meter from LRBG.

variable.name: activeReactionType
variable.description:
reaction type:
-1 = Unknown
0 = No reaction
1 = SMA, Shortening of MA, SUBSET-026 3.8.5.1.3
2 = CSMA, Co-operative shortening of MA, SUBSET-
026 3.8.6
3 = CEM, Conditional Emergency stop, SUBSET-026
3.10.2.2
4 = UEM, Unconditional emergency stop, SUBSET-
026 3.10.2.3

variable.name: activeReactionStatus
variable.description:
reaction status:
-1 = Unknown
0 = No Reaction
1 = Sent,
2 = Acknowledged,
3 = Granted,
4 = Rejected

variable.name: activeReactionDistance
variable.description: 1 = Unknown\nreaction distance in meter, from front end of train

variable.name: routeId
variable.description: route identity\nThis unique information must be coherent with\nthe route table located in the TCL

variable.name: trainId
variable.description: ETCS trainId\n(0xFFFFFFFF if not allocated to a train)
